title: reference request - What is the classification of this group?
body: Let $K=\mathbb C((t))$ and $O=\mathbb C[[t]]$ , and $n\geq 1$ . Consider the matrix $$J_{2n}=\begin{pmatrix} 0& I_n \\ -I_n & 0\end{pmatrix},$$ And let $\Psi : K^{2n}\times K^{2n}\rightarrow K$ given by $$\Psi(u,v)=u\cdot J_{2n}\cdot \overline v,$$ where $\overline{f(t)}=f(-t)$ . What is the type of the group $S(\Psi)_{2n}(K)=\{g\in SL_{2n}(K); \Psi(g,g)=\Psi\}$ ? (as in the table given by Tits) Is it Split? Simply connected? Is $P=S(\Psi)_{2n}(O)$ is a maximal parahoric subgroup? This has been studied by Pappas and Rapoport for a Hermitian $\Psi$ , but I couldn't find any reference for this case.
